ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] WarcWritter limited in time
ygData.msgSnippet: I find a solution. The right class to be modified is the WritterPoolMember in which a checkSize() method closes current file and opens a new file if file size

I find a solution. The right class to be modified is the WritterPoolMember =
in which a checkSize() method closes current file and opens a new file if f=
ile size has passed out maxSize.
However, it needs to recompile Heritrix;  =
it's not an extension which can be added to the lib dir. 
Is there any othe=
r solution ?

Thanks

Romain

Le 14 mai 2013 =E0 16:54, tereo27 a =E9crit :=


> Hi,
> 
> I'm looking for a way to limit in time the WarcWriterProcessor=
 : i want to create a new Warc file each 5 minutes instead of waiting the e=
nd of the crawl or the size limit of the Warc file.
> 
> I developed a Time=
WARCWriterProcessor which extends the WARCWriterProcessor in order to add a=
 "maxtime" attribute which represents the time to wait before creating a ne=
w file. The "write" function is overrided to check the elapsed time since t=
he creation of the current Warc file and to return a "ProcessResult.FINISH"=
 if the time limit is reached. 
> 
> This new "write" function is called du=
ring the warc process but only once : when the warc file is created. I don'=
t understand how work the write process and when the system check the size =
(in my case the elapsed time) of the current warc writter.
> 
> Thanks
> 
>=
 Romain
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_5E0CBDA2-D336-4094-AD9C-6DA83B8B38E0

<br><div><div>Le 14 mai 2013 =E0 16:54=
, tereo27 a =E9crit :</div><br class=3D"Apple-interchange-newline"><blockqu=
ote type=3D"cite">













<div style=3D"background-color: #fff;">
<sp=
an style=3D"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text"><p>Hi,=
<br>
<br>
I'm looking for a way to limit in time the WarcWriterProcessor : =
i want to create a new Warc file each 5 minutes instead of waiting the end =
of the crawl or the size limit of the Warc file.<br>
<br>
I developed a Tim=
eWARCWriterProcessor which extends the WARCWriterProcessor in order to add =
a "maxtime" attribute which represents the time to wait before creating a n=
ew file. The "write" function is overrided to check the elapsed time since =
the creation of the current Warc file and to return a "ProcessResult.FINISH=
" if the time limit is reached. <br>
<br>
This new "write" function is call=
ed during the warc process but only once : when the warc file is created. I=
 don't understand how work the write process and when the system check the =
size (in my case the elapsed time) of the current warc writter.<br>
<br>
Th=
anks<br>
<br>
Romain<br>
<br>
</p>

    </div>
     

    

</div>



<!-- =
end group email -->

</blockquote></div><br></body></html>
--Apple-Mail=_5E0CBDA2-D336-4094-AD9C-6DA83B8B38E0--
